Eu sinceramente daria nota 9.0/10
Portal 1 é um jogo genial! 
Jogo de puzzle mais simples e divertido que já foi lançado.

Prós:
-Jogabilidade extremamente simples e boa
-Glados. Ela carrega o jogo inteiro nas costas com seu humor.
-Trilha sonora magnifica. Principalmente a música dos créditos kkk
-Jogo muito divertido.
-Difícil. Não é qualquer um que consegue zerar sem ir na internet por solução.
-História genial!
Contras:
-É muito curto. Na 1° vez, o jogo dura no máximo 2 horas. Na 2° vez, cai quase pela metade.

Portal 1 é um jogo lendário de puzzle. 
Zerei 2 vezes e recomendo.

9/10

At the time of writing this, I have 13 hours on this game.
I haven't done any of the challenge maps or player-made content. And a run of this game lasts about an hour and a half for me.
This game is one of the most satisfying puzzle games I've ever played, even when I already know the solutions.

Discounting achivement hunting and additional challenge maps, it is impressive to have a puzzle game that you can still enjoy playing even after already knowing how to beat it.
It's a lot stiffer than Portal2, but I enjoyed the puzzles in this one more.
Skeery game
A meh game, not much to it and I wished there was a storyline, to keep you busy it is a fun game but if you wanted an adventure then its not.
gud shiet

This game is so amazing. At first it looks like a simple puzzle game, but it actually has a really good twist in it. It's short, since I've completed it in like 3 hours at first try, but it's entertaining and fun. The atmosphere is awesome, it's simple, but somehow creepy, and GLaDOS is pure perfection. It gives you a few hints about the backstory, but that was not the main point of this game, so they completed it only in the second one. Anyway, this is one of the best games I've ever played.

Si eres amante de los mini puzzle y FPS , este es tu juego que sin duda te hará disfrutas de aquellas horas libres que tengas a disposición.

La historia no es muy complicada ni muy larga, pero tiene ese toque grato de continuar en ella.

Muy Recomendable para distraerte en tu tiempo libre.
A short, but enjoyable game. It has a nice difficulty curve.

Its short length and little story aside, Portal is a great game with brilliant music, dark humour from its antagonist GLaDOS and a weaponised item that shall go down in history as one of the greatest weapons in video game history next to Half-Life's gravity gun, Doom's BFG 9000 and Halo's energy sword.

Short but good. Beat it in less than the play time shown becuase I got a new computer so I had to restart. I would still start with this one before playing 2 just so that you get a better understanding of everything story wise.

Generalidades:
Juego en primera persona, con la mecánica de portales para una mezcla de puzzles y thriller genial.
Historia que en principio parece inexistente, se va introduciendo sutilmente bajo nuestras propias deducciones y no para de aumentar la intriga y el interés hasta acabar con un final satisfactorio.

Jugabilidad:
Simple, pero bien aprovechada.

Gráficos:
Aún con sus años, siguen siendo unos graficos que permiten disfrutar de la ambientación y escenarios.

Duración:
3-5h, dependiendo de el tiempo que te lleve resolver los puzzles.
La duración puede ampliarse por y niveles extras ajenos al Modo Historia.

Valoración:
Juego innovador que combina una interesante mecánica con una historia intrigadora.
Puede encontrarse rebajado a precio irrisorio (2-3€).

I got portal from the orange box. All I was expecting was an overly difficult, puzzling, first person shooter without the killing. All I wanted was Half-Life 2 and to nolonger be a F2P Team Fortress 2 player. Turns out, it is really fun. It is hard to get stumped on (or at least in the main storyline), but it is never to easy. You aways now there is another way, you just have to figure it out. I was able to finish the game in about two hours and 20 minutes. Quick save and load were very useful, but you do get past some puzzles so fast and easily, you do forget about it, and when you need it, you always quick load back to far. Luckily the autosave was there to help. It also comes with bonus maps, if you're like me, and played the game overly fast. Though I will say, the main game took me only a little more than two hours. So is it worth the $9.99? No... But is it worth $19.99 and have it come with EIGHT games along side (Including the classic Half-Life 2 and its episodes)? HECK YEAH! BUY THE ORANGE BOX AND PLAY THIS GAME!

I'm a new comer to portal. I've seen friends play it and understood it was puzzle based but never got around to playing it in its entirety... until last weekend. I have to say the hype for this game was huge when it came out but I never really understood why it got as much love as it did. After playing through it I could finally see why so many have come to love the franchise and is still a topic of discussion to this day.

As far as gameplay goes were looking at a first person puzzle game. We use a portal gun to create two portals (which allow us to enter through one and come out the other in a different place in the room) to progress through the level. It’s a simple premise, get from point A to point B but there is so much depth to the game. You can reach the end of a level in multiple ways, it’s not a one solution type of puzzle game. I've found that the levels have a good learning curve to them. The tutorial levels work well at getting you acquainted with the games mechanics and the levels get progressively more difficult as you complete each stage. 
The stand out sections for me where at levels with robots aiming to kill you, requiring you to take risks and think differently to avoid death and also the infamous final stage which is easy to find out about on the internet as I did know how it played out before but it was a fun stage none the less.

The story revolves around character you’re playing as going through a facility "testing" the portal gun. You are assisted by character called GLaDOS who is an AI unit that directs you by voice. A few laughs were had listening to GLaDOSs “advice” and seeing where the story goes with her. Portal starts and ends on a great note. You are dropped into the world without any clues as to what’s going on, making your way from level to level, slowly discovering the truth of what the facility is. Portal tells a great story without overwhelming with exposition and staged moments.

The graphics look good enough. Portal came out in 2007 and it’s easy to see the age of the game. All in all I was surprised at how well the game worked with newer hardware. I managed to run Portal on an ultra wide screen with 3440 x 1440 resolution. It ran smoothly, I didn't encounter any issues playing through it all. 

Portal holds up as a great first entry into the franchise. As someone who hadn't played it for a decade I can safely say that it’s a great game for all types of players who enjoy puzzles mixed in with an interesting narrative. The mechanics and physics in the game are very entertaining to mess with and it’s a game that encourages creativity in getting through the levels. It took me roughly three hours for a complete play through. Some may find this short but Portal definitely has a lasting impact and will have you thinking about the moments well after the credits roll.

Short, sweet, and awesome. Though incredibly short the game is also incredibly smart. The tutorial is so good it isn't obvious to that you are playing a tutorial. The level design is brilliant, the voice acting is witty, and every piece of the game is made for a reason. Epic, smart, and unique, Portal is a joy that you should definently try.
The game is about two hours in length and is worth all the money you put in it. Would definently like another sequel. Portal is my favorite game of all time.

Consigliatissimo,uni dei miei videogiochi preferiti,con una trama che all'inizio appare piuttosto lineare per poi evolversi notevolmente man mano che si prosegue il gioco,accompagnata da una buona dose di black humor e da un gemapley divertente e coinvolgente che si incastra con splendidi enigmi che si basano su una tecnologia sui portali,antastico il finale.
Il gioco nonostante sia relativamente vecch è ancora pienamente godibile,inoltre il gioco è sviluppato dagli autori di quello splendido gioco che è Half-Life.

One of my favourite games of all time. All I can say is try it. I was reluctant to try it, but I'm so glad I did. The story is enthralling and the gameplay is unique and enjoyable. Play this. You won't regret it.

If you look past all of the stale "The Cake Is A Lie" memes, you have your self a pretty clean cut, innovative experience. Portal may only last a few short hours, but it provides friendships (with your Companion Cube) and a bitter thirst for revenge against a mysterious voice within an equally mysterious facility. If you have not picked it up already, I would suggest this gem as the next part of your Steam library.

Atendendo a diversos pedidos, deixo aqui minha opinião sobre Portal, um dos jogos contidos no pacote The Orange Box.

Um jogo de puzzle feito pela celebrada Valve, Portal é simples e divertido, usando a mesma engine que Half-Life 2. Ao contrário deste, porém, o jogo prefere que você derrote seus inimigos e supere os desafios não como Gordon Freeman e seu pé de cabra, mas como a misteriosa Chell e sua Portal Gun; Uma arma capaz de abrir portais que transportam não só ela, como objetos e líquidos. Passando por vários testes propostos por GLaDOS, a voz robótica feminina que comanda o Laboratório Aperture Science, Chell deve enfrentar torretas automáticas, lança-chamas, poças de ácido e energia desintegrante para poder conseguir o seu prêmio tão esperado; Um delicioso bolo preparado especialmente para ela. 

Além da jogabilidade, algo que me impressionou em Portal foi a sua trilha sonora magnífica, principalmente as duas versões da música de créditos. Você pode baixar a trilha sonora de Portal separadamente usando a aba conteúdo adicional. Recomendo muito.

这里是Aperture Science，你要在这里用生命为我们测试新产品。用传送枪在墙壁上开启传送门进行穿梭，小心地躲避警卫机器人的激光攻击，在Wheatley的帮助下突破一道道难关，解决每个实验室里的谜题，最终大胆的反抗GLaDos。游戏的玩法非常新颖，用传送门位移，配合加速度飞跃，空间无法限制你的行动。

Portal un juego de primera persona  donde controlas a una chica dentro  de las instalaciones de Aperture Science (laboratorio de investigaciones cientificas). En todo el juego estarás superando los desafios a traves de una mecánica muy novedosa donde usarás portales para superar cada reto. excelente juego algo muy distinto a lo que hayas visto antes.

This is one of the greatest games EVER. I loved it. Incredibly unique gameplay, awesome environments, cool minimalist characterizations. I played the entire game in one sitting.
I would like to have seen more secrets and more development of the background. The game ends without ever knowing much about the test subject that left all the messages behind or about the broader scope of what Aperture laboratories was all about. There's a lot of information online that should have made its way into the game itself. 
But as far as an introduction to the Half Life universe goes, I'm totally in. I bought Portal 2 and the original Half Life game. If those games are even half as much fun I'll be happy.

THE BEST GAME I'VE EVER PLAYED...!

Whenever I buy a game, it usually sleeps in the corner after i've tested it for a few days and got bored with it. Very few games have kept me entertaining till the end. But Portal is definitely something else. Even though its classified as a puzzle game, the story is totally amazing. Especially if you notice the subtle things like hints on the floor sometimes when you are puzzled on what to do next. Out in the end in a room I saw a projector showing a powerpoint stating the competitor for aperture tech. It was something irrelevant to the whole game and to the experience. But the fact that such a thing exists takes this to a whole new level. I wish I haven't missed any subtle things.


Coming to the main star of the show. THE AI!!!!!

Without the AI, this game wouldn't have gotten so much praise. The sarcasm, its voice, here and there random language changes, intentional glitches, etc brings a whole new picture into the game. Not to mention the robots that tries to kill us.


Overall I have never enjoyed any game better than this. If there is anyone out there who have played a better game, please do tell me. I would definitely like to play them.
A timeless masterpiece.
